SecurityPractices.name: Strategy & Metrics
SecurityPractices.description: Involves defining a security strategy, setting goals, and measuring progress with metrics to ensure continuous improvement in security practices.

1.description: Basic security goals are identified informally.

2.description: A formal security strategy is documented and aligned with business objectives.

3.description: The security strategy is optimized with proactive planning and stakeholder input.

0.description: No metrics are tracked for security.

1.description: Basic security metrics are collected ad hoc.

2.description: A standardized metrics program is implemented with regular reporting.

3.description: Metrics are analyzed for trends and used to drive improvements.

SecurityPractices.name: Policy & Compliance
SecurityPractices.description: Establishes security policies, ensures compliance with internal and external regulations, and enforces adherence across the organization.

1.description: Basic security policies are informally established.

2.description: Comprehensive, documented policies are in place and communicated.

3.description: Policies are regularly reviewed and updated based on feedback and needs.

0.description: No compliance efforts are in place.

1.description: Compliance is checked informally for major regulations.

2.description: A formal compliance program with audits is implemented.

3.description: Compliance is proactively managed with automated checks and reporting.

SecurityPractices.name: Education & Guidance
SecurityPractices.description: Provides training and resources to staff to enhance their security knowledge and skills, ensuring they can apply secure practices effectively.

1.description: Basic, general security training is offered sporadically.

2.description: Role-specific training programs are regularly conducted.

3.description: Continuous, advanced training is tailored to evolving threats.

1.description: Basic guidance is shared informally.

2.description: Detailed, accessible security guidance is documented and distributed.

3.description: Guidance is proactively updated and integrated into workflows.

SecurityPractices.name: Threat Assessment
SecurityPractices.description: Identifies and evaluates potential threats to the system to understand risks early in the design process.

1.description: Threats are identified informally (e.g., brainstorming).

2.description: Structured threat modeling (e.g., STRIDE) is used consistently.

3.description: Threat identification is automated and continuously refined.

1.description: Risks are assessed informally based on identified threats.

2.description: Formal risk analysis with impact and likelihood is conducted.

3.description: Risk analysis is quantitative and drives proactive mitigation.

SecurityPractices.name: Security Requirements
SecurityPractices.description: Defines specific, measurable security requirements for the software to ensure it meets safety and security standards from the outset.

1.description: Basic security requirements are identified informally.

2.description: Detailed, documented security requirements are specified.

3.description: Requirements are comprehensive, prioritized, and tied to risks.

0.description: No validation of security requirements occurs.

1.description: Requirements are checked informally during development.

2.description: Formal validation process ensures requirements are met.

3.description: Automated validation and traceability are integrated.

SecurityPractices.name: Architecture
SecurityPractices.description: Designs a secure system architecture, incorporating security principles to minimize vulnerabilities.

1.description: Basic, informal reviews of architecture are performed.

2.description: Structured assessments identify security weaknesses.

3.description: Continuous, automated assessments ensure architectural security.

1.description: Basic security patterns are applied informally.

2.description: Reusable, documented security architecture is established.

3.description: Security architecture is optimized and enforced across projects.

SecurityPractices.name: Secure Build
SecurityPractices.description: Ensures the build process produces secure artifacts by incorporating security checks.

0.description: No control over the build process exists.

1.description: Basic build controls (e.g., manual signing) are in place.

2.description: Automated, secure build processes are standardized.

3.description: Build process is fully controlled with integrity verification.

1.description: Dependencies are tracked informally.

2.description: Dependency security is assessed and managed systematically.

3.description: Automated dependency scanning and updates are enforced.

SecurityPractices.name: Secure Deployment
SecurityPractices.description: Manages the deployment process to ensure software is released securely, with proper configuration and validation.

1.description: Basic deployment security steps are followed informally.

2.description: A formal, secure deployment process is documented.

3.description: Deployment is fully automated with security checks.

1.description: Deployment is checked informally post-release.

2.description: Formal validation ensures deployment meets security standards.

3.description: Automated validation is integrated into the pipeline.

SecurityPractices.name: Defect Management
SecurityPractices.description: Systematically identifies, tracks, and resolves security defects and vulnerabilities during development.

1.description: Defects are tracked informally (e.g., spreadsheets).

2.description: A centralized system tracks defects systematically.

3.description: Defect tracking is proactive and integrated with development.

1.description: Defects are resolved reactively without prioritization.

2.description: Defects are prioritized and resolved with defined SLAs.

3.description: Resolution is optimized with root cause analysis.

SecurityPractices.name: Design Review
SecurityPractices.description: Reviews the system design to ensure it meets security requirements and identifies potential weaknesses.

1.description: Informal design reviews are conducted sporadically.

2.description: Structured design reviews are performed consistently.

3.description: Automated tools enhance design review efficiency.

1.description: Controls are checked informally during reviews.

2.description: Formal validation ensures controls meet requirements.

3.description: Continuous validation is integrated into the process.

SecurityPractices.name: Code Review
SecurityPractices.description: Analyzes source code to detect security flaws and ensure coding standards are followed.

1.description: Manual code reviews are conducted sporadically.

2.description: Regular, structured code reviews are performed.

3.description: Code reviews are comprehensive and prioritized by risk.

1.description: Basic automated tools are used occasionally.

2.description: Automated analysis is integrated into the development pipeline.

3.description: Advanced, continuous analysis drives code quality.

SecurityPractices.name: Security Testing
SecurityPractices.description: Conducts targeted tests to verify the software’s resistance to attacks and vulnerabilities.

1.description: Basic security tests (e.g., pen tests) are performed ad hoc.

2.description: Structured, regular security testing is conducted.

3.description: Advanced testing (e.g., fuzzing) is routine.

0.description: No management of test results occurs.

1.description: Test results are reviewed informally.

2.description: Results are tracked and prioritized systematically.

3.description: Results are analyzed to improve testing and software.

SecurityPractices.name: Issue Management
SecurityPractices.description: Manages and responds to security incidents and issues identified after deployment.

1.description: Issues are detected reactively (e.g., user reports).

2.description: Active monitoring detects issues systematically.

3.description: Proactive detection uses advanced tools and analytics.

1.description: Issues are handled reactively without a plan.

2.description: A formal incident response process with SLAs is in place.

3.description: Response is optimized with post-incident analysis.

SecurityPractices.name: Environment Management
SecurityPractices.description: Secures the runtime environment by hardening configurations and monitoring for threats.

1.description: Basic hardening is applied informally.

2.description: Systematic hardening follows documented standards.

3.description: Environment security is optimized and enforced.

1.description: Basic monitoring is performed reactively.

2.description: Continuous monitoring with alerts is implemented.

3.description: Advanced monitoring detects and predicts threats.

SecurityPractices.name: Operational Management
SecurityPractices.description: Monitors and manages the software in production, using logs and alerts to maintain security.

1.description: Basic operational tasks (e.g., patching) are done ad hoc.

2.description: Structured operational processes are followed.

3.description: Operations are optimized with automation.

1.description: Basic log review is performed reactively.

2.description: Operational data is analyzed regularly for insights.

3.description: Predictive analytics improve security and performance.
